title: Elihu Begins to Speak
summary: Elihu, a younger man, becomes angry with Job for justifying himself and with Job’s friends for failing to answer him well. Though younger, he claims wisdom comes from God, not age, and he prepares to offer his viewpoint.

faq.question: Why is Elihu angry?
faq.answer: Because Job justified himself instead of God, and the other friends failed to refute Job’s arguments.

faq.question: Why does Elihu feel qualified to speak?
faq.answer: He believes true wisdom comes from God’s Spirit, not just age.
